titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Student Clubs and Organizations records CA.MS.00022
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Katrina Cokeng, Hattie Ryan, Maris Schwarz,.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-06 16:10:38 -0400.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
Updated to conform to DACS and added boxes

did.abstract: The Student Clubs and Organizations records contains charters, flyers, photographs, programs, articles, and notes documenting most of the student organizations since Smith was founded.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Student Clubs and Organizations records were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Student Clubs and Organizations records, Box #, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00022, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Student Clubs and Organizations records contain information on most of the organizations since Smith College was founded. The records range from the early 1900s to the mid-2000s. Student clubs were formed as a way for Smith College students to engage with one another outside of the classroom. Activities of the clubs included academic, social, and political work. The clubs listed here are not those clubs associated with a particular academic pursuit. Information about these clubs may be found with the departmental records of the specific department in 52. Departments of the classification system. The types of material vary from club to club, but may include charters, flyers, photographs, programs, articles, and notes. Many folders have very little material in them, which often doesn't yield much information about the specific organizations. Usually, each organization's file contains at least a copy of the charter and a few photographs. The files are arranged alphabetically by club or organization name.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Please note that prior to 2018, folder inventories were not always updated when new material was added to the collection. As a result, folder inventories may not be complete and folder numbers may be incorrect.

dao.title: Link to Smith Community Garden blog

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archived Smith Community Garden blog includes posts as far back as 2008 and contains images and news of the community garden activities.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: The blog was first captured in 2015. Subsequent captures are scheduled annually.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archived website of "Hack@Smith: Closing the Gender G(app)" documents the a hackathon sponsored by Smith's Computer Science club, "Smithies in CS". Students from all over the east coast be were invited to Smith's campus for the 24-hour hackathon in March 2015.

dao.title: Link to Hack at Smith website
